description:
Overview of metrics from Prometheus 2.0.  
Useful for using prometheus to monitor your prometheus.
Revisions welcome!

panels.description:
Total number of time series in prometheus

The volume of the current series of the heard block in Prometheus, real-time data, the head block is on the running memory, and the data can be modified
panels.title: Start time

panels.description:
Total number of time series in prometheus

The volume of the current series of the heard block in Prometheus, real-time data, the head block is on the running memory, and the data can be modified
panels.title: Reload time

panels.description: The amount of the current chunk of the heard block in Prometheus, real-time data, the head block is on the running memory, and the data can be modified
panels.title: Head Chunks

panels.description: Total number of chunks created in the head
panels.title: created Chunks

panels.description:
Total number of time series in prometheus

The amount of the current series of the heard block in Prometheus, real-time data, the head block is on the running memory, and the data can be modified

A time series is considered active if Prometheus scraped new data for it recently. Prometheus provides prometheus_tsdb_head_series metric, which shows the number of active time series. Prometheus holds recently added samples for active time series in RAM, so its RAM usage highly depends on the number of active time series. The number of active time series is connected to cardinality via churn rate. See this article on how to estimate RAM usage for Prometheus from the number of active time series and ingestion rate
for link (https://www.robustperception.io/how-much-ram-does-prometheus-2-x-need-for-cardinality-and-ingestion)

Runtime of garbage collection in the head block
GC count

panels.description: Prometheus Scrape Time
panels.title: Scrape time

panels.description: An estimate of the churn rate. Series loads into the cache are considered churn rates. But there are chances of false positives (e.g. series that flashes and disappears) and false negatives (e.g. Series hits sample_limit but is still created in the head block), but generally use as-is
panels.title: Series churn

panels.description: Samples in to remote storage, compare to samples out for queue managers
panels.title: send samples

panels.description: Total number of samples which were dropped after being read from the WAL before being sent via remote write
panels.title: discard sample

panels.description: Total number of times enqueue has failed because a shards queue was full
panels.title: Failed to write to queue

panels.description: Total number of samples which failed on send to remote storage, non-recoverable errors
panels.title: Sample sending failed

panels.description: The number of samples pending in the queues shards to be sent to the remote storage
panels.title: Shard Queue Accumulation

panels.description: Total number of samples successfully sent to remote storage
panels.title: receive samples

panels.description: Total number of samples which failed on send to remote storage but were retried because the send error was recoverable
panels.title: Resend sample

panels.description: The capacity of each shard of the queue used for parallel sending to the remote storage
panels.title: Fragment maximum processing

panels.description: The number of shards used for parallel sending to the remote storage
panels.title: active shard

panels.description:
Duration of sample batch send calls to the remote storage

Processing time for shards sent to remote storage
panels.title: Sample processing time [last a minute]
